dialogue.text: That dual concert at the showroom is what first introduced me to Sweet.
I've never listened to much classical before, but Sweet's music takes that orchestral sound and makes it feel so modern and fresh! I can't get enough of it now.
She's honestly my biggest role model right now, too. That radiant vibe she gives off on stage and her sheer kindness in person is just inspiring.
Sweet takes after her parents. Both of them were very influential classical performers in their prime. Every grandparent out there probably has at least one of their records.
Both have been retired for several years already though. They've been living cozy up in the Preheats, based on what I'm reading.
Ooh, what's living in the Preheats like?
Very vintage feel. Lots of old folk go there to settle.
Nowhere near as modern as Enzync City. You ain't finding anything like me up there in the Preheats.
Sweet was born and raised there, so that explains her very old fashioned manners.
It must've been a hassle to try and come all the way down here for her first concert.
Absolutely. Those plane tickets costs are RIDICULOUS!
I think the boats at the Enzync Dock head over there pretty often. It's gotta be cheaper to take those, at least.
It would be awesome to take a visit there one day. Maybe next summer when we're more free.
Y'know... I wish I could be more proper and refined like she is. Everything about her has this gentle, beautiful feel to it that's just... so enviable.
If you ask me, I think being all prim and proper is overrated. You’re way more fun the way you are, Sunny.
Aww, Syn… I am flattered, but it would be nice to do some nice proper things here and there.
I'd love to own a pretty white dress like Sweet's. I don't really wear dresses ever, but it be a nice change of pace from my usual clothes at least.
I'm hoping to just know more about Sweet in general. She's only recently started to become more prevalent online, so let's see some more from our lovely lady of the orchestra!
